body_html:
I'd like to see how one would do batch major broadcasting with this version of tf.where. that's by far the most useful version and is the one we currently have.
…
On Wed, Oct 3, 2018, 1:31 PM josh11b ***@***.***> wrote: For API review: Contrib is on the chopping block. If we want this behavior, we can't make it in v1.x because it is a backwards-incompatible change. Proposal: export this using: @tf_export(v1="where_v2", v2="where") and add an @Deprecation to the current version of where. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#15982 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim2Lr2KqipOaBfD9UiDmNj2nQ7aZiks5uhR6FgaJpZM4RYgtJ> .

I'd like to see how one would do batch major broadcasting with this version
of tf.where.  that's by far the most useful version and is the one we
currently have.
…
On Wed, Oct 3, 2018, 1:31 PM josh11b ***@***.***> wrote:
 For API review:

 Contrib is on the chopping block. If we want this behavior, we can't make
 it in v1.x because it is a backwards-incompatible change. Proposal: export
 this using: @tf_export(v1="where_v2", v2="where") and add an @Deprecation
 to the current version of where.

 —

body:
I'd like to see how one would do batch major broadcasting with this version
of tf.where.  that's by far the most useful version and is the one we
currently have.

On Wed, Oct 3, 2018, 1:31 PM josh11b <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> For API review:
>
> Contrib is on the chopping block. If we want this behavior, we can't make
> it in v1.x because it is a backwards-incompatible change. Proposal: export
> this using: @tf_export(v1="where_v2", v2="where") and add an @deprecation
> to the current version of where.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
